caption: The food were ok.  Rabbit takes like/looks like drumstick and I didn’t like a fruit taste in ravioli because it’s my main and not my desert.  Lastly and mostly, I didn’t like they charge 25 percent service fee added into the bill for 4 adult table.

Underwhelming. Had the ravioli, lasagna, rabbit, octopus, shrimp, and sea bass (fish of the day). The ravioli was especially confusing - being very sweet yet ladled with Bolognese made it unclear whether it was a main course or a dessert. The sea bass was well cooked, however, lacked sufficient seasoning. The rabbit was somewhat dry and tough. Lasagna was nothing to write home about. Overall, had higher expectations, though the atmosphere was very cozy and romantic.
I've been going to Convivium since they opened almost 20 years ago. The food and atmosphere has been top quality since then.
Excellent food and service!

We recently noticed the Convivium Osteria's well lit & inviting outdoor seating & decided to check it out. We were not disappointed. From venue, to offerings, & service all was excellent. We ordered Risotto Al Frutti Di Mare & Tagliatelle pasta with prosciutto & pecorino cheese melted on top. Drinks we ordered FRATE SCALZO - Rye Whisky, Vin Santo, Orange Blossom Tea, Lemon Juice, Rosemary Sprig . Dessert we ordered Crème Brule. Delish! Our waiter was attentive & his recommendation was on pointe. The owner & chef checked on his guests to make sure everyone was happy. Looking forward to our next visit.
Dinner with coworkers before the holiday. Exceptional food , great atomosphere. Dimly lit, but cozy.  Seating was comfortable for our party  of 6. Highly recommended!
Great location and staff Italian food had rack of lamb and Duck of Ravioli
Good food
OMG MY SISTER TOOK ME HER AND THE FOOD WAS AMAZING I WILL DEFINTILY BE BACK LOVE IT

I stumbled upon this place and had one of the best authentic Italian dishes of my life. The parpadelle in a veal ragu is absolutely delicious. The wine is perfect with a meat and cheese board and the staff is very sweet and welcoming.

My partner and I enjoyed exceptional service on the night we went. The waiter answered all our questions and explained the menu offerings while making their personal recommendations. Stuck between deciding on the ravioli or the rabbit, they even offered to switch the dish should I not find it to my liking. Everything was delicious (I didn't make the switch) and we got to enjoy it all in the lovely outdoor seating area. The menu has some truly unique offerings and I urge you to try something new. I don't think you can go wrong here.

Three trips to the Friuli region recently cancelled!! Luckily a trip to Brooklyn to visit our daughter brought us a step closer to Italy. Real authentic Italian dishes offered and all of ours were delicious. No picture of the polenta with oyster mushrooms & taleggio cheese but it was incredible. Looks like we will be visiting Our daughter more often.
What a beautiful Outdoor, the food is great, i just think that a few of their dishes are more for the winter than summer. Angel is very hospitable ans charismstic. Will be coming bsck soon

8-30-2020-  Myself and boyfriend attempted to try this restaurant yesterday evening. While approaching the restaurant we noticed a empty table away from the sidewalk and proceeded  to try to sit down. We were approached by the service waiter who told us that the seats we picked can only be used by parties for 3 or more.  Due to the  limit of we must sit on the sidewalk. Due to walking traffic on the sidewalk, Our-preference was to sit in the seats we originally picked{Street box} ( this was voiced 3 times nicely ) as genuinely expressed our requested.  The service waiter did not want to make the accommodation to our preference at all and choose to continue to say that we could not sit in the seating arrangement we originally wanted.  We chose to leave due to the uncomfortable nature of his tone. On our way back to our car we noticed that two young white women were sitting there peacefully enjoying dinner., At the same table we told we could not sit at .  Honestly black community please be mindful of tones and micro aggressions as you attempt to dine out. If you do nor feel welcome take your money elsewhere as we are still dealing with discriminatory practices.

I had the best time dining al fresco during Covid. Convivium has by far the most beautiful outdoor seating. My family and I have just moved to park slope from the UWS and this restaurant is a gem in NYC. Food is spectacular! Service is so friendly. Angel makes you feel at home and has a very subtle way to help you with wine choices. I can’t wait to come back.....

Me and my Girlfriend were really looking forward to eating at this restaurant today unfortunately due to the actions of the restaurant we didn’t get that chance The waiter used micro aggressions at me to get us to leave told us that the table was reserved for parties of 3 or more but there was literally no one there What prompted me to make this review was the fact that when we passed back to got to my car there was two Caucasian women sitting in the same seats we had requested It truly sad that even in 2020 and In A pandemic you’re still dealing with prejudice. If you’re a Black person please don’t dine here they don’t want your money
Fine Italian dining with outdoor seating
Great food. During covid you can sit outside. Service was exceptional and timely. You must try the ravioli.
Excellent local spot
Food was very mediocre. Won’t come back.

Excellent food made with fresh ingredients. You can also purchase pastas from the restaurant to make at home. the owner greeted us at the table and was also very friendly the staff was very gracious abd helpful. Definitely will be back
Best food in the Hood, can't wait to eat inside again!

I ordered food for take out here. The food was one of the best meals I've had I all year. After visiting the Italian countryside a few years back I longed for that Italian experience of delicous food and I would try to find it here again in NY. I hit the jackpot here! Plus we found some olives in jar in the mini grocery area and threw those in with the order as well. To my fiancé and my delight we raved about every bite of the food. And the olives where by far the best we have ever had! Thanks for putting so much love in the food and making such special dishes. Everything was very special! ( Side note for the owner: I thought it was an antique shop walking by one day so I didn't notice it.. but my Fiancé noticed a menu outside another day when we where walking together and that's how we didn't just pass it up and walk by, with out ever noticing it was a restaurant)
Squid ink and Octopus are excellent. Go to local Italian spot.
The food is really good and feels very authentic Italian but I was just a bit disappointed by the portion size.
Wow the ravioli is pretty incredible and so is the lamb, polenta and octopus.  Great wine too!  This is such a beautiful cozy spot! Highly recommend!

I hate writing bad reviews, but the way the manager/owner treated us was ludicrous. When i walked in, the first thing he said (older Italian guy smelling repulsively like cigarettes and not knowing what personal space is) was to ask me how I spelled my name after he clearly had it written in from of him on my reservation. Didn't really pay much attention as it happens often. The only table they had was upstairs where there were several crying babies, so I asked if they had a table downstairs, he said no and proceeded to convince me the table he is giving me was the best in the restaurant. I said can you give us a minute to decide and we sat down. 3 mins later he comes and I told him we decided to stay and his response was 'well, don't feel like you are doing me a favor staying. If you don't like it you can leave  I feel like if you aren't 100% happy with the table maybe this is not a good fit for you and you can find another place' What a salty man, If I were with guy friends I was gonna tell him exactly how I felt and the way he spoke to me was unacceptable. But I composed my self and told him, thank you for your hospitality, hope you treat other better. The food could be good, but if someone gets in your face and is being rude with you in front of a lady, a bad review is the least he deserves.
Rustic vibes. Perfect for a date night. Tricolore salad, tagliatelle, and sea bass were beautiful. Only wine, no booze.
A very cozy and charming authentic Italian feel restaurant with delicious food, very friendly staff and great Italian and French oldies playing non stop.
Love this place!!
The restaurant was cozy and warm. The staff was friendly and attentive without being overbearing.
Ambiance. Food was amazing. Get th blueberry tart dessert.

(Translated by Google) We had dinner at the convivium a few weeks ago found on the Michelin guide, we were impressed by everything, starting from the furnishings with attention to the smallest details with period kitchen items downstairs is the cellar with many labels also of fine wines from all over the world, let's talk about food, all very good from octopus to quail from rabbit to lamb to conclude with spectacular desserts made by their kindness and professionalism they are at home we have been very good and we will be back soon .. keep up the good work  (Original) Siamo stati a cena al convivium qualche settimana fa trovato sulla guida Michelin, siamo rimasti colpiti da tutto, a partire dall’arredo curato nei minimi dettagli con oggetti da cucina d’epoca giù al piano di sotto si trova la cantina con tantissime etichette anche di vini pregiati da tutto il mondo, parliamo di cibo, tutto molto buono dal polipo alla quaglia dal coniglio all’agnello per concludere con spettacolari dessert fatti da loro gentilezza e professionalità sono di casa siamo stati molto bene e ci torneremo presto.. continuate cosi bravi
Amazing food,  cozy place , very romantic
Rustic Italian comfort food, hidden neighborhood jem
Wonderful service!
Amazing dining experience!  One of the better ribeye on the bone in NY.

Appetizers were kind of Okay. Four of us have ordered Linguine, one girl couldn't eat it and ordered something else. The others didn't like it at all. It has very specific,fishy like taste. The other main courses(rabit, veal, etc) all scored 2 out of 5 stars.
Place is small and  Intimate Food was great some dishes are spicy...service was great waiter are very friendly and attentive would eat here again
Quite ominous place. At first it was comfy but it's quite closed up and dark... The food was good but not special.
My wife and I love Convivium and have been going there since it opened. The food is so well prepared

Walked in with three friends already knowing we were going to have the steak which was previously recommended by a friend. The owner Michelle was gracious and accommodating, she offered us a portion of the tiny welcoming bar to have some prosecco while we waited for the table to be ready. Ten minutes later we were seated downstairs in a wine cellar crowded with bottles. We right away ordered a few appetizers, an amazing stuffed quail and a charcuterie board to be followed by two massive ribeye steaks that came on wooden cutting boards and sliced at the table by the server. The stakes was perfectly cooked and it was amongst the best steaks we ever had, we paired it all with an excellent carignan from Sardinia suggested by our knowledgeable server Mirko. It felt as if we dined in some rural town in Tuscany. We will definitely be coming back.

Not what it used to be. Loud Spanish music in a restaurant that it supposed to be Italian. The food was just ok. The 2 stars is just because they didn’t charged the gniochi since they weren’t good. We didn’t wait for the desserts.
I had one of the best nights at this place. Great service and very romantic setting.
Ol

The service I received on 10/08/19 was completely unacceptable.  My table was ignored for most of the dinner. Our dishes arrived cold.  We were unable to get a second glass of wine. No water was provided.  We waited 20 minutes to get the dessert menu.  For a place that sets it's prices on the high end, bad service like this shouldn't be acceptable. I asked the only waiter in the restaurant if they were just short staffed. He said that they were fully staffed for the evening, and was unaware of any problems with the service. I used to recommend this place as a great experience, but can no longer. It's a shame.
Amazing food and atmosphere
Great meal, really excellent start to finish
(Translated by Google) Excellent cuisine combined with hospitality and cordiality!  (Original) Ottima cucina  unita a ospitalità e cordialita!
(Translated by Google) Everything, absolutely delicious!  (Original) Todo, absolutamente delicioso!
From the moment we were seated, I realized that Convivium Osteria will forever more be my favorite place to eat. I highly recommend this amazing experience to all who appreciate  living in the now.
Went there Thursday before the Backstreet Boys concert and it was the closest thing I’ve had to the Italian food we got in Italy. Delicious, authentic and good service!
Great family dinner - just hitting it between casual and formal
Great service, food and atmosphere! What more could you want!
Grub is ard
Great little spot! Loved the food and the staff was super friendly.
Said they'd turn up the ac, never turned it on -- hot, hot, hot.

This was a great meal. We we're lucky to be seated in the lower level especially since the heat wave was in full force. The menu is very unique. It is not often that you find rabbit on the menu. And it’s less frequent even when you do find it that the meat is tender and delicious. There were so many fun things to try for example, for appetizers we had the octopus, the artichoke, burrata, and the salad. I probably could’ve stop there. But we went onto a main entrée with a number of different options all very delicious. The steak was made exactly to her liking medium rare on the rear side. And it was carved tableside perfectly. We also had the Seabass. I was very happy that we were able to order a deboned. I never enjoy taking bones out of my mouth while I’m eating.  For dessert we ordered the tiramisu, the flourless cake, and custard which of the three was my least favorite. The tiramisu was very good and highly recommended. What I liked about it is that it wasn't overly sweet. Flourless cake was pretty good though I’m not a big fan of too much chocolate that late at night. It was however about the only gluten-free option on the menu.  If I had one disappointment about eating here is that there was no gluten free pasta on the menu. I would’ve thought by now that most restaurants would have a evolved their offerings to include gluten-free pasta. But all in all the dining experience was really good. I would’ve given them foreign a half stars but half stars are not an option on this app. I really enjoyed it and I hope to return in the near future.  Oh and I really love the waiters hair design. He had this really cool style. I love when people take time for their appearance and also to say something really cool about their personality. It was a great experience overall.

This is a "mom and pop" Italian restaurant with extensive wine selections. It had rustic charm, beautiful that lovely. Such a warm, romantic space for a perfect date! It is a rather small space, but they do have another room downstairs, which can be used for a private event.  We had a few appetizers to share; Burrata con Pomodoro e Basilico, and Ravioli di Mele. Burrata dish was fresh and tasty, refreshing on a hot, steamy day. Ravioli had a nice sweetness to it, packed with flavor!  We also had their infamous Carciofo alla Romana, which is a Braised Artichoke. It was unique and impressive. The heart was almost creamy, melt in your mouth.  They had a few special of the day, and one of them was lasagna. We didn't order it, but we got a small sample, and it was soooooo good!  For main, I chose Spigola al Forno, a ‘Whole’ Mediterranean Sea Bass It came out beautiful! One of the owners, Michelle, filleted it for me right there. The first bite of the fish gave me such joy...it was absolutely delicious! We enjoyed this dish very much!  My hubby went with Agnello in Crosta di Pistacchio, a Sicilian Pistachio Crusted Roasted Rack of Lamb. It had a great crunchy exterior with plump and juicy inside. Packed with flavor, tender and very satisfying.  We ended with Tiramisù and Torta di Cioccolato. It was one of the best Tiramisù and flourless chocolate cake I’ve ever had!  We had an amazing dinner here, I am so happy to have discovered this restaurant! Everything we had was superb, we enjoyed them all from the first bite to the last. Our main server, Valentine, took a great care of us. If you want to have some authentic, delicious food with family and friends, or have a very romantic date, this might be the perfect spot for you!

Strangely they refused to make me a vegetarian pasta other than the one veggie item on the menu (which was so-so) clearly they had ingredients to do it so I found it baffling. Also the service was not good, it took forever and multiple requests to get drinks.
Their Michelin rating speaks for itself. Shared a charcuterie board, and the lamb dinner was incredible! Mariano took great care of us.
Guests must try the rack of lamb.  So delicious!
A great experience. Fantastic food, friendly service, and a very cool wine list. Perfect for a date night.
Hospitality was so so authentic.and genuine.  Food was superb and deserts, all homemade, were the best ever.
Lack of vegetarian/vegan alternatives was kinda disappointing, and surprising for Brooklyn

Nothing to write home about. I chose this place based on reviews. The service was nice, however the dish that I ordered, not sure of the name but the waiter called it their "signature dish"... It looked like pasta (Chef boy'ardee out of the can). The plate wasn't decorated and the meal tasted like a 5 minute do-it-yourself at home pasta w/crumbled italian sausages mixed in. Not to mention my date and I were dressed to impress, thinking that it was an upscale place.

Convivium Osteria has been our favorite restaurant every time my family and I want to dine out. Every item on their menu is delicious and high quality. Wine list is very extensive, you will find wines from Italy, Spain, Portugal and USA. As per ambience is probably the most romantic restaurant in Brooklyn. Service is very attentive and always happy to help you choose your wine or food. Overall, I highly recommend this place whether you are celebrating a special occasion or If you just want to grab a bite. It is by far the best restaurant in Park Slope. Im looking forward to dining here again.

I was looking for an Italian restaurant in Brooklyn after an Barclays center event. But luckily it happened that I found Convivium. The home made pasta is incredible especially the green apple and cinnamon ravioli with duck ragù. Something that will keep me going there forever. We followed Our server recommendation and we ordered the ribeye steak the is a huge piece of meat that was melting in our mouths. Congratulations guys keep going

Convivium Osteria is one of my favorite spots in all the city. Really authentic Italian cuisine. You feel transported straight to Italy with the rustic and cozy atmosphere that this place have. The staff is always gentle and professional and the food OMG! Just try you won’t regret
Lovely intimate place!
Excellent atmosphere

It has been my favorite spot in Brooklyn for many years. They serve authentic italian food along with a professional yet friendly environment. I highly recommend it. Try their ribeye steak that you can match with one of countless wines they have in the cellar
The food was excellent. My wife and I will definitely be returning to this wonderful restaurant.
I'm a loyal customer of this restaurant and just to say that the new manager is a disaster... so much details to report but I won't.
The most amazing steak i ever had
well done italian dishes, cozy environment
Great environment, great location and perfect for date night. Would give it 5 stars but it's a hair short from being a 5 star restaurant. I would def go back.

We called and made reservations. We walked into the restaurant it was completely packed. Not a problem we waited and becuase there was no space I waited outside and sat on the bench in the cold. My Husband called and said our table was ready . The waiters took us downstairs to one of the tables, this made me happy because we were not upstairs with all the commotion. The waiter came over we order sparkling water and then the hostess or manager whichever one she was came to our table and asked us to move. I was completely taken back people began to stair and look at the only two African Americans in the the restaurant as we are being asked to move upstairs becuase she promised another couple a downstairs table. So we get up not making a fuss although I was HIGHLY UPSET. Thinking we were going to get sat right away, again we had to wait while the other couple was politely moved from the table at the door downstairs to our table. I do not understand this type of customer service. There were 3 other seats at the long table we were seating at downstairs.  ( pleanty of room). To make matters worse the hostess or Manager bribes us with a free appetizer as though thats going to make our dining experience more enjoyable. We sit at this uncomfortable table in the corner cold and all.i can see at eye level is the other patrons waiting to be sat and I have to look at there backside while I try to enjoy a meal. I was so taken back and upset and this type of service my husband and I walked out. I will not be back nor my husband and our  company business luncheons and dinners we will take elsewhere.
One of my favorite restaurants in Park Slope. Wonderful service, food and great atmosphere for couples or small groups.

We were strolling along 5th street came across this little place and went in. The main area is small and it was about one third occupied. The host walls up to us asks if we have a reservation, we say no...hethen tells us that the wait will be an hour for a table...as I said mostly empty restsurant.  The website made no mention of required reservations and indicated that the wait during peak time was about 15 minutes...perhaps it was the fact that we both have locs that changed the wait time in a mostly empty restsurant to one hour...even the other patrons looked uncomfortable when we were told the wait time...you never know who you are refusing to serve just based on appearance. The one star is  because it looked like a very cosy and romantic place...we will never know. Shameful!!!
Amazing place. Wine selection is great. Staff is very polite and knowledgeable. This is hidden gem of Brooklyn.
Great place excellent service.
Amazing food, wine and decor - very cosy.
Excellent cuisine! Try the olives and polenta!
Food, service, atmosphere - all amazing! Definitely will be back!!
Absolutely incredible. Nothing left on the plate good

Cozy, traditional, beautiful restaurant. The food is amazing, the flavors are so natural and traditional home made food. There great wine menu and the desserts are fantastic!! The staff is very helpful and nice. This restaurant is the best Italian of Brooklyn (without pizza)
The service became significantly worse. The food is overpriced. I have been going to CO since 2009, and unfortunately have become disappointed. Sad to say that Most likely will not come back.
Awesome food and beautiful place. Loved the wine cellar. 😍

Excellent Italian food. A hidden treasure in Park Slope. The the staff were super accommodating from start to finish. If you're looking for some Italian cuisine that isn't your usual fare check out this restaurant. Definitely a five-star if I could give it 6 I would!
Small place but good food
Best Italian food
(Translated by Google) A nice tavern in New York  (Original) Una bella osteria a new York

Excellent quality ingredients along with great preparation make for a wonderful cullinary experience.   Stuffed squab was tasty and rack of lamb melted in my mouth.   Very friendly and attentive staff.  Highly recommended!!😀
The food was okay but the waitress very rude.  Some hosted a function there and she yelled at some of the guest like they were her children
Delicious!
1st class service, great decor, and wonderful food and wine! A great night out. Thanks.
Down home grandma cooking it was great
The food was absolutely delicious and the Waiters were very nice. Very cute n small restaurant. I loved it.
Food and service was amazing. Cute spot for a date night or pharmacy lecture. Downstairs has a wine cellar it's a very romantic vibe.
Excellent food and wine! Staff was very helpful and polite. Definitely would go again.
Incredible food great service!

Tried multiple appetizers lamb rack and pasta with shrimp. Overall food was great. Loved the artichoke, baby octopus from appetizers. Lamb rack was delicious and nicely cooked. Bit overcooked shrimp in pasta.  Panna Cotta was not the best. Overall great experience. Not the fastest service. Nice quiet restaurant.

(Translated by Google) Excellent cuisine, friendly staff who are always attentive to customer needs. The environment is clean and well-kept, reminiscent of an old Italian tavern. Most of the staff speak Italian as the owner Carlo who comes from Sardinia. A must try if you are traveling to New York!  (Original) Una cucina ottima, il personale gentile e sempre attento alle esigenze del cliente. L'ambiente è pulito e curato, ricorda una vecchia osteria italiana. La maggior parte del personale parla l'italiano come il titolare Carlo che viene dalla Sardegna. Assolutamente da provare se siete in viaggio a New York!
(Translated by Google) A restaurant where quality and courtesy merge.  (Original) Un ristorante dove qualità e cortesia si fondono.
excellent
Love this place. Been going since it opened. Great food, wine and bread
Wonderful food and service. Came here last summer and my boyfriend happened to make a reservation here for Valentine's Day without knowing. It was a very pleasant surprise.
They food was great! The lamb plate was yummy!
Solid Italian food. Service was ok, had to ask for a glass of wine twice.
Enjoyed the octopus appetizer.
One of the few places around that specializes in portuguese food and wine, which are both amazing. Great staff too!

Incredible rustic Italian and Mediterranean cuisine, can't really go wrong with any of their dishes, but they do a very good grilled octopus and braised rabbit if it's on the menu. A bit on the pricey side, but it's really worth it.  I usually don't care about restaurant decor, but the atmosphere of this place is very distinct and charming. The walls of the main floor are covered in copper cookware and the basement floor is a converted wine cellar. Very memorable and adds to the experience.

It takes a lot for a restaurant to “wow” me but I can gladly say that I am amazed by this place. I could not fault it one bit. The waitress was extremely helpful and warm, the food was insane and the wine was some of the best wine I’ve drank (we got the soave).  I travel the world a lot with work and I love “eating out” so believe me when I say that whoever runs this place has truly thought about every aspect of your experience  Try it for yourself and see if you can fault it. I couldnt
The food was amazing and delicious; the antipasti quail we ate was so exquisite and mouthwatering. A must visit when in Brooklyn, NY.
Romantic, rustic, cozy! An Italian gem in Brooklyn steps from the Rusty Turtle (Barclays Center).
Amazing food! Great wine 🍷 and coconut berry tart cake was mind blowing that I even ordered new one to go 😘👌
Amazing food and service. Staff is sweet and very knowledgeable, helpful in deciding what to choose! Place is small and cozy. Definitely make a reservation ahead of time!

I arrived early and we had a party of 10.we had already made reservations for the large room behind the kitchen. Luckily we did since the place was already at capacity. There is a good reason for so many people. The food and the service  Andrea (Italian amn) was our server and he was so attentative to all our needs. I am pretty sure some of the guests drove him a little crazy but he was making sure we had a great time, and he succeeded. We started out with charcuterie and the board of cheese and dreid meqts were amazing, especially the one with the guava. We had quinoa salad, some salad with shards of cheese, the burrata, the stripped artechoke and the shrimps. Thats the way to enjoy a place to start. We also had the Rioja wine that was 100% tempranillo. It was quite nice and delicious to drink. Some of the female guests had white wine which they enjoyed. They entrees we all had differed from Lamb chops, red snapper fillet, there was a hen and a type of ravioli not made from pasta. I had the snapper which was well prepared and really good. We ordered the 3lbs steak to share and wow is all i can say. The service was getting better since it was getting late. We also had some good service from other waiters and Elenea. I dont know how to spell her name and she was a treat to converse with.  What a night and we left there closing out the place and enjoying a cery evening.

We have loved going to this restaurant for years, but last night was a let down. While the food was excellent, as always, the service was terrible. The maitre d’ was much more interested in his phone than his customers. He was unfriendly and bordering rude.
Tasty but pretty expensive. Expect to pay over $30 for some lamb, even the cheapest entree is nearly $20
I love this restaurant amazing food and amazing wine. The service is at the top like in Europe
The food was insanely good. Very quiet, romantic setting in the back...wife and I loved it.
Superb service and dark cozy atmosphere both romantic and intimate.  Prime rib dish is still strong in my memories.
Extraordinary food! Cozy setting...attentive waitstaff

This place is perfect! So understated from the outside but inside is a true gem. The food is fabulous and the ambiance adds something truly special. When people ask me where to eat when going to the Barclay center this is what I suggest. The artichoke is stand out for vegetarians and meat eaters alike.
Amazing ambiance, good food, great wine selection!

Very much like the place. Very cool decor. Comfortable lighting and seating.Had the meat ragut pasta dish and it was very good. The pasta was perfectly made. I thought the proportion was a little bit small but otherwise delicious.  My wife had a pasta dish with a lot more olives and maybe come and death my dish was a lot better. She did enjoy her butt. The dish I ordered was far superior. The rest of the group had appetizers or salad and they seem to enjoy it.
Amasing stake, very cozy, good service, good wine.

Wonderful dinner option in the neighborhood with a romantic /rustic atmosphere. Food is yummy enough to keep me coming back when I want an easy but elegant meal out ! Food more Italian than Portuguese, though !
Greatest I have seen!
Very good food, exquisite presentation, great service, beautiful design and a must visit wine cellar downstairs.

Great atmosphere, really cozy downstairs seating with good music and interesting wine. The food wasn't great and the menu left something to be desired in general. Such a shame, because I was super excited for this place to impress me.
Romantic atmosphere, great wines and amazing food. Love their octopus abd steak for 2 which is easily big enough for 3
Get the Peking duck ravioli
Superbrestaurant, delicious food and italian farmhouse interior. I have never been disappointed.  Haven't been there in a while but will definitely return soon.
Absolutely loved this place.  The food was fantastic and the staff very friendly.  I think my favorite part was how cozy it was.  It was perfect for a date night.
Great spot for our yearly anniversary

One of the best restaurants in Brooklyn! The apple-cinnamon ravioli is one of my favorite dishes. The lamb is also delicious; wonderful wine selection as well. It's intimate atmosphere makes it the perfect spot for a special occasion or date.
I wish the servers were nicer. The rabbit is amazing.
Excellent Portuguese food. Very decent selection of wines. Lovely atmosphere. A little bit pricier than expected (in the $$$ category, not $$).

We've been going there for 8 years with my wife and feel at home at convivium. Great for a romantic date or for visiting friends/ family. Amazing selection if wine. The cold cuts - gnoccies are our go to as well as the impressive meat that tastes like heaven :)
Romantic settings with good quality food and wine.

I live 15 blocks away. Somehow on this cold night, finding myself wife and child free, I couldn't find a better place to go in between.  Tried the soup for the first time tonight. Single, yet a depth of flavor that belies the simple ingredients. Well worth it with the extra crusty bread tonight.  The octopus, always a favorite, continues to satisfy.  Thanks Carlo and Michele.
Good dinner spot to take a date. One of the better restaurants in brooklyn
Delicious meal. Great wine. Charming gracious efficient staff and very fast kitchen. We will go back!!
The food was out so quick, we thought they brought it for another table!! The pasta was fresh, hand made and delicious.
Serious winner. Small menu,  great execution,  great service, nice space,  decent price (you know... For NYC). And finally an Italian restaurant in the new 'hood that we like!

Favorite restaurant in NY for over 10 years. The food is to die for. I would recommend the spinach gnudi and their Nebraska chuleton but you can't go wrong with any option of the menu. It is consistent every single time. The wine list has infinite options and Sergio will make sure you pick well. The music (exquisite Fado) and decoration (copper rustic accents) will make you feel like home (a Spaniard talking). Plus, their staff is fantastic. Michelle and Carlo are the sweetest owners.

Gorgeous little place, phenomenal food, great service. Best rack of lamb I've ever had, and even the accompanying roasted cauliflower (not my favorite veg) was amazing. Wine (a $65 Chianti Classico) a little disappointing for the price, but not a big deal. Will definitely be back!

AMEX OR CASH. That being said, it's an absolutely phenomenal restaurant and the food was exceptional. The lamb chops and the quail were exceptional. Also so was the octopus! Good Italian wine selection. Very fun, quirky service from our French waiter, who was very knowledgeable. Wasn't aware that I had to pay by AMEX or cash. Was told to get cash from the deli from across the street. But of a downer as was unaware but 5* nonetheless.

Small, attractive space. Very interesting wine list with many selections from Portugal. They seated us as walk-in though it was pretty late (about 9:30). We enjoyed a Portuguese wine the server recommended. The braised rabbit was excellent as was the quail appetizer. I had the apple ravioli with duck ragu which was quite sweet and somehow not what i was expecting. Very good Portuguese play list on the music system that evening as well.
Great ambiance and service. Quiet, relaxed and romantic. Good food.

One of my most memorable meals ever was created and served here at Convivium. I would recommend reservations as this is a small and rather romantic destination. The staff is attentive and the European inspired menu never fails to please the palate. Bonus Tip: The grilled octopus and the braised rabbit are two of the best renditions I've ever had.
The apple and cinnamon ravioli with duck ragu is absolutely to die for. If you're attending an event at the Barclays Center, build time in your schedule to come here first, trust us.

Quick Summary:Made my birthday reservations at this restaurants based off all the great reviews it received. Called them 2-3 weeks in advance for a party of 7 and I was all set. That was the last positive thing I have to say about this place. Here comes the problems:  Stay us at the front of the restaurant and only gave us 6 seats. I told them the reservation was for 7. They didn't offer a bigger table, to accommodate the additional person, just another chair. Bread: The bread they put on the table had a piece of metal in it.  Not a small smooth metal, but something with spikes in it.  I told the manager and he said, "I'm so sorry, the bread isn't made here, we get it delivered on a daily basis".  No Free  Meal, drinks or even dessert.  Food was bland. Service was slow.  I will never go back here!  Too many options in Park Slope for me to choke on a pointy metal object!

I've been here twice and it's been excellent both times. A real unique, authentic food experience. The steak is possibly the best I've ever had - this comes from someone who grew up eating locally raised beef from small farms before that was a thing. Complete the experience with a Portuguese wine.
Excellent food, low key restaurant - reasonable prices.
The service is OUTSTANDING. And I'm not likely to say that about any place. It is pricy, but certainly worth the penny for the experience.
Glass of Spanish wine and the Atlantic snapper, both delicious and outstanding decor. Definitely worth visiting again, as their wine selection is superb.
I had my birthday dinner here recently and it was like we stepped out of Brooklyn. The food was simple but outstanding - great flavors and ingredients.
Rustic romance, delicious food, major aphrodisiac of a date spot. Lovely garden seating downstairs.
Beautiful atmosphere, delicious entrees and dessert. Expensive, but perfect for a romantic date.
Great food, great service. When my meal got mixed up the chef hooked us up.

Greatest little Italian restaurant in Brooklyn.  The downstairs cellar is such a romantic place to eat and the menu has lots of great dishes.  Start out with the giant platter of meats and cheese and don't pass on the 48oz Ribeye for 2.  Huge wine selection.
Bigger than it looks, you can even eat down in the wine cellar. Excellent level of service and food was superb.

Absolutely fantastic place. For appetizers we had the grilled sardines and the grilled baby octopus, both good. But the star of the evening was the Rabbit With Polenta entree, absolutely delicious, cooked just right with fantastic mediterranean flavors to it. Highly recommended if you go there, just get the rabbit, okay?  Also, totally ask to sit downstairs in the wine cellar. Make reservations, it's a long wait otherwise.

Off the beaten track?  You betcha. Walk through these doors, you're not even in Brooklyn any more.  You feel as if you're dining somewhere on the coast of Portugal. I would actually come here just for the charming decor if the food and service weren't so good. After a superb dinner here you feel like you haven't just dined out, you've traveled!
Too bad!! Great restaurant with the best prix fixe in town.
While the food is good, the best part of the experience is the decor. Great date place.
Unique atmosphere. Ask to sit in the wine cellar. The food was fine, but a tiny bit overpriced. I'll come back.
Wonderful food in a beautifully presented restaurant with exceptional service.
superb mediterranean food in gorgeous taverna surroundings - could easily be in portugal

Mouth watering food all-around. I would definitely come back however my wife refuses. We waited for two hours for a table that we were supposed to have held for us. Anywho, my wife won't come back here because of that, and it's too bad too. They serve the best-best-best gourmet meat dishes in Brooklyn.
amazing food in a relaxed setting with a wonderful wine list.
this restaurant makes you feel like you are in a foreign country - comfortable.  the wait staff educates you on their offerings.
